title: Assistant Social Media Manager
content:
Fender Musical Instruments Corporation is a world-famous brand with offices across the globe. Within Fender Musical Instruments Corporation’s ("FMIC") China marketing team, we will connect the culture and product legacy of Fender with Chinese consumers and musicians, support them at every stage of their music career.
An American icon, Fender was born in Southern California and has built a worldwide influence extending beyond the studio and the stage. A Fender is more than an instrument, it’s a cultural symbol that resonates globally.
We are searching for an Assistant Social Media Manager based in Shanghai, to contribute on driving substantial growth for Fender China social media and rejuvenating the player community with key stakeholders. 
Essential Functions: 

Develop social strategy for Fender China:

Responsible for performance growth of all Fender China social media outlets, including impressions, engagements, sentiments and traffics
Lead social media content development for performance increase
Identify social media boost opportunities  
Develop key social influencers list and own the relationships


Oversee development and editorial calendar planning:

Partner with Product, Creative, Artist and Marketing function to develop monthly content calendar for all social media platforms.
Review all scheduled channel posts for accuracy, grammar, voice/tone and relevancy prior to posting and coach Social Media Coordinators as needed.
Lead creation of and distribute weekly reports measuring and analyzing campaign metrics with the goal of adjusting tactics to optimize growth, engagement and overall performance, leverage insight to identify opportunities for improvement and rationale for execution of campaign


Manage day to day relationships with key social media vendors and channel partners including Weibo, Wechat, Bilibili, Douyin, Red.
Lead the creation of analytics reporting and online listening to create insights reports ensuring that the brand has a constant pulse on fans’ feedback.
Responsible for the further development of Fender community in China
Stay current on what’s trending in Chinese social environment as well as what’s changing social media in order to provide strategic POVs and recommendations.

Present case studies, learnings and findings to the marketing team, Fender Hollywood team and sales teams bi-annually


Draft social media portion of go-to-market plans for new product launches, integrating creative assets, events, other campaigns etc.

This involves leading team brainstorms and developing planning documents.


Directly manage social agency, lead communication with global social team and distributors, lead training with distributors.
Partner with Ecom team to drive traffic and grow and retain our fan base
Work closely with vendor and Ecom’s customer services to monitor and make strategic recommendations on how to engage through social channels, providing prompt, accurate customer service to customers and providing direction to other channel coordinators on the team

 
Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree, major in Business, Marketing or related field is preferred; 
Pr3+ years’ experience in related field with a successful and proven track record; 
Strong understanding of Fender Brand and Guitar & Chinese music community; Playing guitar is a big plus; 
Savvy with current and emerging digital tools, technologies and social platforms (Weibo, Wechat, Bilibili,douyin, Red as well as international social media); 
Strong Internet sense, sophisticated copywriting skills and demonstrable creative/concept skill;
Experiences working with campaigns within timelines and budgets.
Multi-lingual (English highly desired), comfortable working within an International organization and able to influence for positive outcomes
Proficient in Office tools, include but not limit to Microsoft Office, Photoshop, Premier etc. 

 
About Fender Musical Instruments:
Fender Musical Instruments Corporation (FMIC) is one of the world’s leading musical instrument manufacturers, marketers and distributors, whose portfolio of brands includes Fender®, Squier®, Presonus®, Gretsch®, Jackson®, EVH®, Charvel®, Bigsby®, and Groove Tubes®, among others. For more information, visit www.fender.com. Fender Musical Instruments Corporation is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, color, religion, disability, veterans’ status, sexual orientation, or any other protected factor.
